intro: Angostura ossana, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves and produces small, red berries that are edible but often have a spicy flavor. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other parts of the world, where it can become invasive. The plant's botanical features make it easily identifiable in both its natural and cultivated habitats.
